title: My first pet Yorp
content:
Hi, this is my first pet Yorp. Hope you like it, because I didn't. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img] But I just wanted to know what you think about this drawing, and , maybe someone can tellme what does a yorp leg looks like?
[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/yorp_s1.png[/img]

EDIT: I drew this late at night, with a paper and a standard pen.

EDIT2: I enhanced it with The GIMP. It still needs minor improvements [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-spotkeen.gif[/img] :

[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/yorp_22.png[/img][hr][img]http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/983/vegetableswk2.gif[/img]

title: Yorp!
content: Looks great. Shade him up a little, and you're good to go. I like how the feet look, honestly. Good sense of depth and stability.

title: Re: My first pet Yorp
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Good sense of depth and stability. [hr][/quote]
Unless the yorp is meant to be leaning backwards I can't say it looks really stable. The left feet gives indeed some depth but the rest of the yorp is pretty much flat. Especially the eyes look like a road sign, you should use some skin fold to change that unless you want to keep your style really simple.
I don't want to negative but you asked for opinions.
I agree with you that the feet are difficult to do, keep practicing but I also agree with Xky that they don't look that bad.
-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: My first pet Yorp
content:
I probably would have put the feet right under him (rather than on the sides), but I like these too. I've always found it hard to give yorps a body shape that pleased me.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]
